rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about dealing with crises.

All families experience crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help BEFORE something bad happens, we can overcome any crisis.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about dealing with crises.

All families experience crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help BEFORE something bad happens, we can overcome any crisis.

media_title.eng: How will knowing how to deal with a crisis help me and my family?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crises may occur anywhere. Crises may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.

rows.media_title: How will knowing how to deal with a crisis help me and my family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crises may occur anywhere. Crises may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.

media_title.eng:
Hear a caregiver's testimonial

Placeholder text - Anna - we need a media  title similar to the intro one

media_transcript.eng:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through ParentApp, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!

rows.media_title:
Hear a caregiver's testimonial

Placeholder text - Anna - we need a media  title similar to the intro one
rows.media_transcript:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through ParentApp, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis can happen to anyone.

Let's see what happened with @data.characters.female_child_4.name  and @data.characters.female_caregiver_2.name:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis can happen to anyone.

Let's see what happened with @data.characters.female_child_4.name  and @data.characters.female_caregiver_2.name:

character_1_text.eng: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?

rows.character_1_text: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
It‚Äôs my Uncle, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he touched me.

character_1_text.eng: It‚Äôs my Uncle, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he touched me.

character_2_text.eng:
(ü§î_thinking_) Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen.

"Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I am listening."

rows.character_2_text:
(ü§î_thinking_) Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen.

"Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I am listening."

rows.character_1_text: It is true, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I did not want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

character_1_text.eng: It is true, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I did not want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.

rows.character_2_text: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.

rows.character_1_text: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that‚Äôs when it happened.

character_1_text.eng: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that‚Äôs when it happened.

character_2_text.eng: It is okay, I believe you my child. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help we need. Where could we go for help?

rows.character_2_text: It is okay, I believe you my child. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help we need. Where could we go for help?

rows.character_1_text: Ah I know, let‚Äôs go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?

character_1_text.eng: Ah I know, let‚Äôs go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?

character_2_text.eng: Yes‚Ä¶ Okay‚Ä¶ But will you come with me?

rows.character_2_text: Yes‚Ä¶ Okay‚Ä¶ But will you come with me?

rows.character_1_text: Of course I will. And @data.characters.female_child_4.name? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this.

character_1_text.eng: Of course I will. And @data.characters.female_child_4.name? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This was such a difficult situation for @data.characters.female_child_4.name  and her @data.characters.female_caregiver_2.name! And this can happen to other girls, and boys too.

Thankfully, @data.characters.female_caregiver_2.name gave great support @data.characters.female_child_4.name. Let's think about what she did well.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Another problem that many parents are worried about is violence and crime. Let‚Äôs look at an example together.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Another problem that many parents are worried about is violence and crime. Let‚Äôs look at an example together.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.male_child_2.name, you've looked worried since yesterday. What is wrong?

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.male_child_2.name, you've looked worried since yesterday. What is wrong?
Yesterday, my friends and I went to a soccer match. Some guys who were drunk started a fight with my friend.

character_1_text.eng: Yesterday, my friends and I went to a soccer match. Some guys who were drunk started a fight with my friend.

character_2_text.eng: Continue, I am listening. I hope you did not fight?

rows.character_2_text: Continue, I am listening. I hope you did not fight?

rows.character_1_text: I did not want to, but I could not just stand there and let them beat up my friend, so‚Ä¶

character_1_text.eng: I did not want to, but I could not just stand there and let them beat up my friend, so‚Ä¶

character_2_text.eng: So, did you fight in order to help defend your friend?

rows.character_2_text: So, did you fight in order to help defend your friend?

rows.character_1_text: Everyone was fighting. I saw someone lying on the field in a pool of blood. He looked‚Ä¶ dead.

character_1_text.eng: Everyone was fighting. I saw someone lying on the field in a pool of blood. He looked‚Ä¶ dead.

character_2_text.eng: I am glad you are telling me about this, @data.characters.male_child_2.name. Let‚Äôs sit down together now and discuss whether we should involve the police or someone else to help.

rows.character_2_text: I am glad you are telling me about this, @data.characters.male_child_2.name. Let‚Äôs sit down together now and discuss whether we should involve the police or someone else to help.

character_2_text.eng: We will get through this. Remember, we will support you as a family.

rows.character_2_text: We will get through this. Remember, we will support you as a family.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills to help you deal with a crisis!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills to help you deal with a crisis!

text_2.eng: **Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think:**

section_1_text.eng: Stay calm. Ask yourself, "What does my teen need right now?"

section_2_text.eng: Tell them you are there for them and love them.

section_3_text.eng: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? You might need to make immediate plans now and then long-term plans later.

section_3_extra_text.eng: You can be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help!

rows.text_2: **Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think:**
rows.section_1_text: Stay calm. Ask yourself, "What does my teen need right now?"
rows.section_2_text: Tell them you are there for them and love them.
rows.section_3_text: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? You might need to make immediate plans now and then long-term plans later.
rows.section_3_extra_text: You can be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
It is helpful to practice dealing with crisis before something happens.

Look at these five family crisis times. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember: BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK

text_1_facilitator.eng:
It is helpful to practice dealing with crisis before something happens.

Look at these five family crisis times. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember: BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK

character_1_text.eng: The test said I have HIV. I am scared I am going to die."

Crisis 5: @data.characters.female_child_4.name  is pressured into sex by her boyfriend.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice their module skills at home get better results.

This week's home activity is to look back at the five crisis examples we just learned, and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice their module skills at home get better results.

This week's home activity is to look back at the five crisis examples we just learned, and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family.

text_2.eng:
Choose one of the example to discuss with your teen:

- Crisis 1: @data.characters.male_child_4.name fights at school
- Crisis 2: @data.characters.female_child_1.name gets pregnant
- Crisis 3: @data.characters.male_child_2.name makes a girl pregnant
- Crisis 4: Someone in the family may get sick
- Crisis 5: @data.characters.female_child_4.name is pressured into sex by her boyfriend.


**And remember:**
üòå BREATHE (Stay calm)
üëÇüèæ LISTEN (Assure your teen you are there for them)
üí≠ THINK (What might help this situation?)

media_title.eng: Placeholder - context needed here Anna (this is a media title of teen testimonial)

media_transcript.eng:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with ParentApp, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.

rows.media_title: Placeholder - context needed here Anna (this is a media title of teen testimonial)
rows.media_transcript:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with ParentApp, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.
